message: I have my five fingers and am looking for a good running route from the hyatt, any suggestions?
there is a homeless shelter near the park, been told it can be quite dangerous... could get your adrenaline going running by? :)
The hotel has a gym with treadmills, but that's tedious. Otherwise I've been told Piedmont park in Midtown is really nice, has some running paths.
Do you buy the breeze card at the station? I may attempt the early rise tomorrow just for some pre-conference adventure.
@steve_piercy looks nice! maybe I should pay it a visit!
oh, this one is better: walking and jogging paths: http://www.piedmontpark.org/do/walks.html
I'll have to look into that. If possible I would like to run outdoors rather than on a treadmill.
Friday conf. runs 9a-6:30p; Sat 8:30a-6:30p; Sun 8:30a-4p.  Looks like early morning runs are the way to go unless you don't mind darkness or missing sessions.

Yeah, the MARTA Midtown train station is 3 stops north of Peachtree station. I bought a Breeze card for 7 days of unlimited rides for $18. Good deal. With all the traffic, intersections, stop and go of the downtown area, it would be best to get outside. Also perhaps check out Centennial Park where the Olympics were held. I've been told it's a nice place to visit, but don't know about running trails there.

Yup, any station. From the hotel registration desk, go left, turn right and go across the skyway to Peachtree Center. Turn right into the MARTA train station. It's a little bit twisty/turny, but eventually you can hit the ticket machines. They accept credit/debit cards and cash. More info: http://www.itsmarta.com/

Ah cool. credit cards accepted. Good to know. I'm going to try to wake up by 6:30 and head out. Let me know if you want to meet up in the lobby or something. Otherwise I may see you at the park! I'll be wearing a bright green woot-shirt, tortoise killing the hare.
Assuming the weather is nice, Piedmont Park is beautiful at this time of the year.
I'll check back here in the AM. If I'm awake, by 6am, I'll head out for a quick jaunt.
I might be up for Saturday AM?
anyone else doing the JLA Shamrock run on Sunday?
Going to hit some weights tomorrow, and try for running on saturday or sunday AM.
